snippet: Traditional fishermen and environmental agencies have been working to impose new regulations on trawlers they say are depleting the herring population in New England.
abstract: Fishermen and environmental organizations, groups that have traditionally been at odds, are working together to impose new regulations on trawlers they say are depleting the herring population in waters off New England; trawlers account for 98 percent of the 100,000 tons of herring caught annually.
lead_paragraph: Traditional fishermen and environmental agencies have been working to impose new regulations on trawlers they say are depleting the herring population in New England.

headline.seo: New England Fishing Rules Aim to Protect Herring
headline.main: Odd Alliance Is Forged Over Access to Herring
headline.print_headline: Odd Alliance Is Forged Over Access To Herring
